item.title: Senior Analyst, Campaign Analytics & Execution
item.description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

We are looking for a talented individual to join our team in the position of Marketing Data Analyst, Campaign Analytics & Execution. This individual will be responsible for Campaign Analytics supporting the Private Wealth Business.

The role will sit on the Wealth Digital, Data & Analytics team and support with sizing, execution, channel loading, performance tracking for multiple wealth campaigns. This individual will drive insights to existing campaigns and will be responsible for developing and supporting the creation of new dashboards for existing and new campaigns. The successful candidate will be able to go beyond analytics/reporting to provide actionable insights and implement analytics/machine learning solutions to senior leadership.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Be proactive supporting Private Wealth business. Think strategically and work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Work with internal clients and diverse stakeholders to understand their business objectives, scope and KPIs and translate them into actionable campaigns projects.
  • Produce dashboards, reports, analysis, insights that drive decisions and help us build better campaigns and experiences.
  • Manage and enhance daily/weekly/monthly campaign reporting to provide results and context to deliver actionable insights to senior management, not just reporting data
  • Improve and automate process using a variety of tools to drive operational efficiency
  • Manage, prioritize, and respond to ad-hoc requests
  • Take the lead on campaign performance measurement and increasing productivity of all marketing initiatives
  • Research, design and implement campaign reporting infrastructure that leads to automated and flexible reporting

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2 years of proficient work experiences in the Financial industry and Consumer Campaign Management & Execution data analysis
  • Demonstrated proficiency in working with large varied datasets, both structured and unstructured data, using SAS. Other assets - proficiency in SQL, R, Python, Tableau, Power BI and Spotfire
  • Post-Secondary education in Business Analytics, Math, Computer Science, Statistics, Actuarial Science, or Business
  • Good verbal and written communication skills; able to effectively present analytics data to business users at the Manager / Senior Manager level
  • Experience in running campaigns through design, execution and performance tracking
  • A strong passion for data, charts, analysis, trends, and evangelizing data usage
  • Knowledge of Private Wealth and understanding of current market trends are assets
  • Self-Starter - Strong relationship-building skills. Ability to thrive on a high-degree of independence and ownership
  • Experience in machine learning/deep learning algorithms are assets

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

item.title: Senior Manager, Operations Technology Automation
item.description:
Address:

250 Yonge Street

Job Family Group:

Strategy & Change

  • Experience working with UiPath, Power Automate RPA Tool
  • Knowledge of Process Mining Software would be an asse

Spearheads the intelligent automation practice delivering the next wave of performance efficiencies enabled by Artificial Intelligence, Data & Analytics, and Technology. Creates and applies strategies to work with internal stakeholders to establish the foundation and governance for Intelligent process automation to maximize return on their investment, reduce costs, mitigate risks, streamline processes and improve the customer experience. Collaborates with internal stakeholders to understand and challenge their current processes and develop solutions to build confidence by demonstrating success and uncovering opportunities to deliver business value. Understands business needs, identifies opportunities for Intelligent automation, crafts business & technical requirements, defines scope, mitigates risks, leads project, and manages issues and timelines. Manages all project requirements to execute approved plans.

  • Fosters a culture aligned to BMO purpose, values and strategy and role models BMO values and behaviours in all that they do.

  • Ensures alignment between values and behaviour that fosters diversity and inclusion.

  • Regularly connects work to BMO’s purpose, sets inspirational goals, defines clear expected outcomes, and ensures clear accountability for follow through.

  • Builds interdependent teams that collaborate across functional and operating groups to create the highest value for all stakeholders.

  • Attracts, retains, and enables the career development of top talent.

  • Improves team performance, recognizes and rewards performance, coaches employees, supports their development, and manages poor performance.

  • Understands business needs, and collaborate with internal stakeholders to prioritize opportunity areas.

  • Works with internal stakeholders to prepare a business case to facilitate green-lighting of initiatives.

  • Partners with internal stakeholders in Technology and the business to define project scope, budget, resourcing plan, and timelines.

  • Collaborates to deliver initiatives, managing and communicating risks/issues.

  • Provides thought leadership and problem solving support across various in-flight projects.

  • Leads the design, development and implementation of robotic solutions that meet business objectives.

  • Participates in interviews, brainstorming sessions and workshops with key stakeholders to document current and future state business process.

  • Translates current business processes into strategic smart process solutions – including Cognitive Automation – as a Robotics Subject Matter Expert.

  • Builds high quality robotics solutions that are intuitive for senior audiences, simple to maintain, and drive business outcomes.

  • Work closely with internal stakeholders to determine current capabilities, business needs and priorities.

  • Collaborates with the platform vendor (e.g. Workfusion) to influence the product roadmap to ensure BMO’s business needs are effectively understood and prioritized.

  • Fosters relationships with internal stakeholders to raise awareness and evolve standards that support Intelligent Process Automation.

  • Defines business requirements for analytics & reporting to ensure data insights inform business decision making.

  • Educates business stakeholders to evaluate and implement smart automation initiatives.

  • Guides internal stakeholders through the intake, business case, and delivery of smart automation initiatives.

  • Leads change management programs of varying scope and type, including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives.

  • Leads the development of the communication strategy focusing on positively influencing or changing behaviour.

  • Collaborates across BMO to develop communications strategies and ensure consistency of messaging, in order to positively influence or change behaviour.

  • Contributes to refine the project intake process to standardize and streamline for future projects.

  • Contributes to standardize the project delivery methodology and approach.

  • Identifies and recommends process improvements and best practices for future projects and initiatives.

  • Defines, implements, and improves processes for intake, delivery, and ongoing maintenance of initiatives.

  • Contributes to define and evolve standard practices to support the needs of Smart Automation Initiatives.

  • Assists with developing goals, measurement framework, and strategies to monitor effectiveness of projects.

  • Becomes an expert in implementation costing and sizing, including identification of opportunities to optimize spend.

  • Acts as the day-to-day problem solving during intake, implementation, testing, deployment, production.

  • Evaluates intelligent automation practice (IPA) strategy and approach and conducts research on emerging IPA approaches and technologies.

  • Documents and socializes enterprise standards and practices related to IPA.

  • Collaborates with Technology to understand and finalize information technology infrastructural and environment needs.

  • Creates proof of concept (POCs), demos, videos and other items as required to prospect new opportunities.

  • Stays abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to IPA.

  • Works to develop IPA strategy, governance and control frameworks for the enterprise.

  • Works with business process experts to identify and document best use cases for automation, defines business cases and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.

  • Analyzes and transforms business processes and designs a strategy and solution leveraging robotics process automation, machine learning and other AI capabilities.

  • Creates and maintains an initiative intake process.

  • Develops and refines leading practice IPA approach and methodology.

  • Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of solutions.

  • Crafts business and technical requirements in partnership with the business and technology teams.

  • Leads and manages all phases of the IPA project lifecycle, including design, development, testing. deployment and sustainment of solutions

  • Helps ensure project adherence to established processes, standards and best practices for IPA.

  • Finalizes project governance, scope, effort estimates and defines project timelines and exit criteria.

  • Establishes the project management rigour including publishing status updates, meeting notes, action items.

  • Organizes kick-off workshops to engage the business and technical teams to start the project.

  • Maintains a risk and issues log and works with stakeholders to close issues and mitigate risks.

  • Manages delivery to agreed-upon milestones and sprints, proactively communicating bottlenecks to leadership.

  • Maintains the backlog of features and works with business and technology to confirm trade-offs and priority.

  • Owns the sprint execution and delivery while collaborating with business and technology stakeholders.

  • Solves problems through a combination of escalation, including recommending options, reviewing trade-offs, facilitating decisions with senior leaders, and following up to execute on approved decisions.

  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Ensures alignment between stakeholders.

  • Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.

  • Operates at a group/enterprise-wide level and serves as a specialist resource to senior leaders and stakeholders.

  • Applies expertise and thinks creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine.

  • Implements changes in response to shifting trends.

  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

Qualifications:​

  • Typically 5 - 10 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

  • Bachelor’s degree with concentration in computer science, engineering, information systems, information technology or other related majors such as business & administration.

  • Master’s degree with concentration in machine learning, data science a plus.

  • In-depth knowledge of Robotics / Intelligent Process Automation, Machine Learning, and Data Driven solutions.

  • Experience in working with senior business and technology stakeholders and subject matter experts to implement projects.

  • Participated in cross-functional programs from conceptualization to delivery and ongoing operations.

  • Experience in process mapping and transformation.

  • Experience in managing an SDLC a Plus.

  • Experience in leading product roadmaps a plus.

  • Experience in project planning and execution, including scoping, budgeting, and risk / issue management.

  • Experience with Workfusion, UiPath application and other tools.

  • Seasoned professional with a combination of education, experience and industry knowledge.

  • Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth / Expert.

  • Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth / Expert.

  • Influence skills - In-depth / Expert.

  • Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration - In-depth / Expert.

  • Able to manage ambiguity.

  • Data driven decision making - In-depth / Expert.

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. item.title: Lead, Data Science Engineering
item.description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

Leads the design and delivery of data driven experiences within BMO Wealth Management.  As an expert at the intersection of analytics and digital, you’ll lead efforts to build out analytics products and digital capabilities that span multiple areas of the business.  You will leverage insights from customer behaviour and market trends to drive the overall customer experience definition and prioritization of work to ensure what matters most to our business and customers is always at the forefront.  You’ll provide product and technical expertise in the analytics space to manage the business and people impacts of the team’s work and work across functions, to bring together stakeholders and integrate technology, business groups, geographies and customer segments that align to the targeted business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads the product solution design and execution
  • Main point of contact between Digital Product Owner and Data, Analytics & Strategy team, plan scope release activities in alignment with overall digital release plan
  • Supports the execution of Machine Learning/AWS Cloud focused technical initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders (Product, Technology, Corporate Support Areas, business partners, etc.)
  • Leads product backlog review sessions and manage items so the team has a constant list of prioritized activities to execute against, aligned to business priorities
  • Owns the release management scope and planning activities, providing a forward-looking view to stakeholder teams and leadership that maps back to roadmap prioritization
  • Analyzes customer response and usage behaviour data and information to provide insights and recommendations
  • Decides how to address requirements/user stories/product needs within the analytics sphere
  • Builds effective relationships, collaborates and coordinates activities with internal/external stakeholders including third party suppliers in order to deliver on business objectives
  • Manages audit documentation and path to production artifacts, approvals and release forms (e.g., Change Requests, Deployment Request Forms, testing documentation and signoff\'s, etc.)
  • Leads weekly status calls and tracking of dependencies for the overall program, acting as a single point of expertise on current and planned work items
  • Co-owns regular updates to leadership, cross-functional team members and enterprise data and analytics group
  • Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of solutions; Represents the “voice of the customer” for the analytics and digital customer experience, familiar with customer feedback/pain points
  • Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business
  • Monitors and tracks customer experience and interaction with launched products, process performance and other metrics; leads the prioritization of work to address any issues
  • Provides input to the planning and implementation of changes in the channel operations environment
  • Works with development and platform teams to ensure quality and timeliness of changes into the channel operations environment and ensures any performance issues are addressed
  • Supports the tracking, prioritization and resolution of issues related to customer experience including tracking of Key Performance Indicators and client conversions
  • Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus related to analytical environments and data pipeline development
  • Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support

Required skills:

  • Typically 7+ years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Experience with Machine Learning and implementing data pipelines between multiple environments including on-premise and cloud systems
  • Experience with AWS cloud capabilities and an understanding of cloud infrastructure
  • Hands on coding with Python
  • Managing development processes and identifying innovative ways to develop industry leading analytics experiences
  • A high level of curiosity, comfort with ambiguity and willingness to challenge the status quo
  • Experience in Agile methodology and/or working in cross-functional teams (preferred). Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience

Preferred skills:

  • Previous experience working in a financial services, banking or regulated industry
  • AWS Cloud expertise (will also consider Azure)
  • Previous experience as a Software Developer would be an asset (Python)

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

item.title: Senior Analyst, Hedging and Risk Modeling, Asset and Liability Management
item.description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Finance & Accounting

Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Supports the strategy and roadmap for data quality, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of decision support tools.

Supports the research and development of quantitative risk modeling methodologies and related strategies in support of managing structural market risks arising from business/group portfolios and products. Develops and implements models to ensure market risk in banking products are properly measured and support effective risk management practices. Works with internal and external stakeholders to ensure market risks are properly identified and understood with supporting models and strategies successfully implemented.

  • Displays strong interest in Banking (primarily) and Asset Liability Management (secondarily)
  • Understands and can explain delta hedging concepts
  • Has an affinity for risk modeling process
  • Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
  • Affinity to build reports to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.
  • Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of solutions.
  • Provides input to policy positions with respect to structural market risk programs considering legislative requirements.
  • Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy.
  • Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
  • Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
  • Conducts independent analysis to resolve strategic issues.
  • Provides input to the planning & implementation of structural market risk data acquisition and reporting programs.
  • Documents data flow, systems and processes in data collection to improve efficiency; advances automation of processes.
  • Maintains operational procedures and processes relating to data acquisition, analytical and reporting processes.
  • Develops analytical solutions, models and methodologies used to manage risks related to the Bank’s portfolios and products e.g. valuations; hedging strategies, customer behaviour models, performance measurement, etc.
  • Monitors the financial market environment and model performance impacts for optimal execution of risk strategies.
  • Ensures compliance with model risk and market risk governance and provides financial instrument transaction oversight.
  • Works closely with businesses and corporate partners to perform enterprise wise stress testing of the bank’s Net Interest Income in support of capital adequacy assessment
  • Performs analytics and reporting of economic and P&L performance of Corporate Treasury as a result of its hedging, investment and funding activities.
  • Researches industry best practices with respect to structural market risk modeling and methodology
  • Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
  • Monitors and tracks changes to position and component risk metrics over reporting periods; addresses and / or escalates any issues.
  • Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
  • Works with various data owners to discover and select data from internal and external sources e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system.
  • Applies scripting / programming skills to assemble source data into structured datasets with multiple levels of granularities e.g., demographics, customers, products, transaction.
  • Applies suitable statistical techniques to perform analysis e.g., A/B testing, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning to test, verify, refine hypotheses.
  • Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to deliver on business objectives including third party suppliers.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
  • Participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes.
  • Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
  • Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
  • Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

    Qualifications:

  • Relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Degree in either Financial Engineering, Computer Science, Economics or Risk Management preferred
  • Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tools.
  • Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
  • Required Programming Skills: Excel/VBA
  • Nice to have: Bloomberg, R, Python, SQL, SAS
  • Strong knowledge of Excel, Access, SQL, VBA.
  • Working experience in a Finance environment with exposure to one or more of the following:
  • Risk management, financial market products and pricing, Balance Sheet / Asset Liability management.
  • Knowledge of quantitative modelling including understanding of statistics, risk and financial metrics.
  • Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
  • Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
  • Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
  • Influence skills - In-depth.
  • Data driven decision making - In-depth.

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

item.title: Senior Manager, Wholesale Credit Methodology
item.description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

We are hiring a Senior Manager to join our Wholesale Model Development team! We are looking to bring a retail-like mindset capability into wholesale by developing behavioral models for the wholesale segments. This is innovative work as we bring our capabilities from one area into another and will allow us to increase efficiency at annual review time while providing enhanced risk monitoring.

We are a growing team,  deeply entrenched with the business we support and in our BMO Winning Culture Mindset. Come join our team and help bring our vision to life!

This role will provide modelling support to the Credit & Growth Analytics team (C&GA) and its objectives while sitting within the Risk Capital & Modelling Development team. The mandate of the C&GA team is to contribute to the growth, financial performance and productivity aspirations within the Ambition 2025 strategy by leading and executing projects that leverage advanced analytical techniques and decision automation in new use cases throughout the Enterprise.  The modelling function is one of the key aspects of such projects.  Supports the research and development of quantitative risk modeling methodologies and related strategies in support of the management of risks arising from the projects undertaken by the C&GA team. Applies knowledge of analytics algorithms and technologies to develop forward looking models and analytic solutions that ensure risks are properly identified, understood and risk related strategies are enabled. Summarizes statistical findings, draws business conclusions, and presents actionable business recommendations used in the management of risks and related activities e.g. associated internal controls; enterprise-wide stress testing and scenario analysis; capital modelling; valuations. Drives innovation through the development of data products that can be leveraged across the organization and establishes best practices as well influences data governance guidelines and policies.

This role will have a dual reporting structure, reporting primarily to the Director, Wholesale Credit Methodology but also the Head, C&GA.

  • Fosters a culture aligned to BMO purpose, values and strategy and role models BMO values and behaviours in all that they do.
  • Ensures alignment between values and behaviour that fosters diversity and inclusion.
  • Regularly connects work to BMO\'s purpose, sets inspirational goals, defines clear expected outcomes, and ensures clear accountability for follow through.
  • Builds interdependent teams that collaborate across functional and operating groups to create the highest value for all stakeholders.
  • Attracts, retains, and enables the career development of top talent.
  • Improves team performance, recognizes and rewards performance, coaches employees, supports their development, and manages poor performance.
  • Provides strategic input into business decisions as a trusted advisor.
  • Makes recommendations to senior leaders on strategy and new initiatives, based on an in-depth understanding of the business/group.
  • Acts as a subject matter expert on relevant regulations and policies.
  • May network with industry contacts to gain competitive insights and best practices.
  • Acts as a subject matter expert on relevant regulations and policies.
  • Oversees the development and delivery of tools and training reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users.
  • Influences and negotiates to achieve business objectives.
  • Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
  • Manages resources and leads the execution of strategic initiatives to deliver on business and financial goals.
  • Recommends business priorities, advises on resource requirements and develops roadmap for strategic execution.
  • Develops and manages comprehensive information management systems; designs and/or leads initiatives to improve processes, analysis and reporting.
  • Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
  • Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
  • Acts as the prime subject matter expert for internal/external stakeholders.
  • Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
  • Makes recommendations to senior leaders on strategy and new initiatives, based on an in-depth understanding of the business/group.
  • Defines business requirements for analytics & reporting to ensure data insights inform business decision making.
  • Develops and applies the framework for databases; oversees database management in adherence with data governance standards.
  • Monitors and tracks performance and addresses any issues.
  • Leads the execution of ad-hoc analytics and reporting solutions and cyclical programs; assesses and adapts as needed to ensure quality of execution (8,9).
  • Leads change management programs of varying scope and type, including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives.
  • Leads the development of the communication strategy focusing on positively influencing or changing behaviour.
  • Collaborates across BMO to develop communications strategies and ensure consistency of messaging, in order to positively influence or change behaviour.
  • Leads the execution of operational programs; assesses and adapts as needed to ensure quality of execution.
  • Develops analytical solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
  • Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of analytical solutions.
  • Works with stakeholders to identify the business requirements, understand the distinct problems, and the expected outcome and models and frames business scenarios which impact critical business processes and/or decisions.
  • Works with various data owners to discover and select available data sources from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system) to fulfill analytical needs.
  • Applies scripting/programming skills to assemble various types of source data (unstructured, semi-structured, and structured) into well-prepared datasets with multiple levels of granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
  • Develops agreed analytical solution by applying suitable statistical techniques (e.g., A/B testing, prototype solutions, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning, artificial intelligence) to test, verify, refine hypotheses.
  • Summarizes statistical findings and draws conclusions and presents actionable business recommendations. Presents findings & recommendations in a simple, clear way to drive action.
  • Documents data flow, systems and processes in data collection to improve efficiency and apply use cases.
  • Performs experimental design approaches to validate finding or test hypotheses.
  • Uses the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns.

item.title: AWS Cloud Engineer
item.description:
Address:

4100 Gordon Baker Road

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

Experience with Glue, Redshift and SnowFlakes preferred

  • Be responsible for the planning, implementation, and growth of the AWS cloud infrastructure
  • Build, release, and manage the configuration of all production systems
  • Manage a continuous integration and deployment methodology for server-based technologies
  • Work alongside architecture and engineering teams to design and implement any scalable software services
  • Ensure necessary system security by using best in class cloud security solutions
  • Stay current with new technology options and vendor products, evaluating which ones would be a good fit for the company
  • Implement continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines when necessary
  • Recommend process and architecture improvements
  • Troubleshoot the system and solve problems across all platform and application domains
  • Oversee pre-production acceptance testing to ensure the high quality of a company’s services and products
  • Experience designing and building web environments on AWS, which includes working with services like EC2, ELB, RDS, and S3
  • Experience building and maintaining cloud-native applications
  • A solid background in Linux/Unix and Windows server system administration
  • Experience using DevOps tools in a cloud environment, such as Ansible, Artifactory, Docker, GitHub, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Maven, and Sonar Qube
  • Experience installing and configuring different application servers such as JBoss, Tomcat, and WebLogic
  • Experience using monitoring solutions like CloudWatch, ELK Stack, and Prometheus
  • An understanding of writing Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC), using tools like CloudFormation or Terraform
  • Knowledge of one or more of the most-used programming languages available for today’s cloud computing (i.e., SQL data, XML data, R math, Clojure math, Haskell functional, Erlang functional, Python procedural, and Go procedural languages)
  • Experience in troubleshooting distributed systems
  • Proficiency in script development and scripting languages
  • The ability to be a team player
  • The ability and skill to train other people in procedural and technical topics
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

As a special aside, an AWS engineer who works in DevOps should also have experience with:

  • The theory, concepts, and real-world application of Continuous Delivery (CD), which requires familiarity with tools like AWS CodeBuild, AWS CodeDeploy, and AWS CodePipeline
  • An understanding of automation

item.title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
Address:

55 Bloor Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

Applies knowledge of advanced analytic algorithms and technologies (e.g. machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence) to deliver better predictions and/or intelligent automation that enables smarter business decisions, improved customer experience, and drives productivity. Applies strong communication and story-telling skills to summarize statistical/algorithmic findings, draw business conclusions, and present actionable insight in a way that resonates with business/groups. Drives innovation through the development of Data & AI products that can be leveraged across the organization and establishes best practices in in alignment with Data & AI governance frameworks of BMO.

As a data scientist of the Machine Learning and Applied Research Team, you will be accountable for building advanced analytical solutions and predictive models for North American Personal and Business Banking.

  • Develops analytical solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
  • Diagnoses and resolves predictive / analytical model performance issues while monitoring system performance and implementation of efficiency improvements.
  • Works with various data owners to discover and select available data from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system, and alternative data) to fulfill analytical needs.
  • Applies scripting / programming skills to assemble various types of source data (unstructured, semi-structured, and structured) into well-prepared datasets with multiple levels of granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
  • Develops agreed analytical solution by applying suitable statistical & machine learning techniques (e.g., test and learn, prototype solutions, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence) to test, verify, refine hypotheses.
  • Summarizes statistical findings and draws conclusions, presents actionable business recommendations. Presents findings & recommendations in a simple, clear way to drive action.

Qualifications:

  • Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or other quantitative disciplines and/or equivalent experience
  • Experience with distributed computing language (e.g. Hive/Hadoop/Spark) & cloud technologies (e.g. AWS Sagemaker, AzureML).
  • Experience with programming languages (e.g. SQL, Python, R, SAS) and machine learning /deep learning algorithms/packages (e.g. XGBoost, H2O, SparkML).
  • Deep proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms.
  • Previous experience in building models for a Financial Institution is an asset.

We’re here to help

55 Bloor Street West

The Financial Crimes Unit (FCU) brings together our Cybersecurity, Fraud, Physical Security and Resilience Planning capabilities to address the ever-growing and increasingly complex global security environment. item.title: Enterprise Architect - Data and Analytics
item.description:
Address:

6 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Technology

Creates a visionary IT big data and analytics architecture roadmap and organizational strategy to align business needs with technologies. Leads the creation of the strategic enterprise big data and analytics architecture for BMO. Partners with internal stakeholders to define the principles, standards, and guidelines regarding data flows, data aggregation, data migration, data curation, data consumption, data placements, data analytics, machine learning and AI. Provides expertise regarding data architecture in critical programs, data strategy and data quality remediation activities. Validates data architecture for adherence to defined policies, standards and guidelines including regulatory directives. Partners with broader internal stakeholders to define architectural possibilities and futures. Works with business and development teams to recommend processes or system design enhancements. Ensures that systems are functionally appropriate, technically sound, and well-integrated.  

·        Defines & develops target & reference architecture, standards, best practices and leveraging leading big data & analytics architecture practices and advanced data technologies.

·        Develops governance processes around data leveraging the enterprise data architecture framework.

·        Applies innovative Data, Analytics & AI technologies with business insights to enterprise big data & analytics platform architecture, to meet complex and enterprise scale business and IT needs.

·        Develops and maintain technical roadmap for enterprise big data & analytics platform for different platform capabilities.

·        Supports projects/initiatives related to data acquisition, processing and utilization through enterprise big data platform.

·        To be a technical leader viewed as a thought leader for innovation in big data, machine learning and AI areas. Thought out for their architectural depth and breadth.

·        Provides advice and guidance to assigned Group/Functions on implementation of data & analytics solutions.

·        Provides input to project teams to ensure that their processes and deliverables align with the target state architecture.

·        Challenges the architecture validation process and other relevant enterprise data governance areas.

·        Identifies data architecture opportunities for a broad, diverse, and complex set of business functions and processes.

·        Develops and maintains strong working relationships with internal stakeholders in enterprise, technology and business groups in order to ensure adherence to data architecture standards.

·        Researches/monitors industry activities to keep abreast of relevant data technologies.

·        Recommends technology direction about the feasibility and applicability of such technologies within the environment.

·        Works with business partners to analyze strategy and trends to define the requirements, principles, and models that guide technology decisions;

·        Provides strategic input into business decisions as a trusted advisor.

·        Works with internal stakeholders to provide architectural recommendations and guidance and departmental presentations.

·        Leads and facilitates the design of technology projects and applications.

·        Acts as the prime subject matter expert for internal/external stakeholders.

·        Reviews technical work.

·        Develops and recommends productivity aids to accelerate delivery.

·        Creates and manages key architecture assets for the designated portfolio and business scope.

·        Ensures sound and robust architecture and provides sufficient guidance for the successful implementation of solutions to mitigate negative enterprise technology and budget impacts.

·        Identifies risks or issues with technology solution and design that may impact realization of project benefits, and guides and supports stakeholders in making good decisions that proactively resolve or mitigate potential project risks/delays.

·        Participates in the system specification review process to ensure system requirements can be translated into valid software architecture.

·        Identifies and researches relevant technologies, performs proofs of concept / prototypes, and recommends the applications of such technologies for future product architecture.

·        Provides input into the preparation of business case.

·        Identifies opportunities to strengthen the capability of the technology organization (e.g. sharing architectural expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks).

·        Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities, and individual learning.

·        Provides architectural expertise and domain knowledge to advise and guide senior leaders.

·        Operates at a group/enterprise-wide level and serves as a specialist resource to senior leaders and stakeholders.

·        Applies expertise and thinks creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine.

·        Implements changes in response to shifting trends.

·        Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

 

Qualifications:

·        Typically 7 - 15 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

·        Possesses a university degree/college diploma in related discipline(s) with concentration in computer science, engineering, information systems, information technology or other related majors such as business & administration.

·        Solid hands-on working experience on enterprise level data platform and analytics solutions (e.g. Data Warehouse, Big Data, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, SAS…);  

·        Solid proven working experience in data governance and enterprise data management domains including Data Security, Data Strategy, Data Quality, Master Data Management, Data Catalogs, Data Lineage

·        OSS Data Technologies including Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Hue, Jupyter Notebook, Livy, Python, R, MariaDB, GraphQ and etc.

·        Familiar with ODPi community and products

·        Knowledge of cloud development platforms preferred

·        AWS hands on experience and AWS cloud architect or big data certification a plus;

·        Experience with SAS products: SAS Viya;

·        Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift, Glue;

·        Experience with Azure cloud services: Power BI, Databricks, SQL DB, Data Factory;

·        Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc;

·        Experience with implementing disruptive technologies in an organization;

·        Experience with Complex & high volume cloud implementations;

·        Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases;

·        Experience with multi-faceted technologies (web development, network, distributed databases, big data, mobility, etc.);

·        Passion for technology &/or domains;

·        Innovations / Patent examples;

·        Possesses knowledge in financial industry business knowledge as well as knowledge of major data consumption use cases in financial services.

·        Exhibits knowledge of data architecture concepts and practices.

·        Demonstrates knowledge of major regulatory frameworks related to risk data aggregation (e.g. BCBS239).

·        Demonstrates knowledge of architecture frameworks, methodologies, and tools. (e.g., possesses The Open Group Architecture Framework [TOGAF] accreditation).

·        Possesses strong knowledge of Data Architecture Maturity Evaluation concepts and metrics (e.g., ACMM).

·        Possesses expert communication skills, both written and oral.

·        Demonstrates solid consulting and client management skills.

·        Is energetic, personable, and achievement- and outcome-oriented.

·        Exhibits relationship management and managerial leadership abilities.

·        Seasoned professional with a combination of education, experience and industry knowledge.

·        Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth / Expert.

·        Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth / Expert.

·        Influence skills - In-depth / Expert.

·        Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration - In-depth / Expert.

·        Able to manage ambiguity.

·        Data driven decision making - In-depth / Expert.

item.title: Data & Analytics Risk Officer (AI Technology & Machine Learning))
item.description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Audit, Risk & Compliance

The Data & Analytics (D&A) Risk Officer will be responsible setting strategies and policies on how risks associated the design, delivery and ongoing management of data and analytic platforms, tools and processes in BMO. This role is accountable for monitoring D&A technology landscape (people, process and technology) and managing the range of these risks to ensure that they are identified and “bad risks” are addressed in a timely manner.  

This includes emerging technologies used to deliver advanced D&A platforms including, Cloud solutions, Open Banking, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), etc. operated in-house or provided by 3rd parties. 

Key Accountabilities:

The role is accountable for the following primary activities:

  • Enterprise risk management strategies and policies: Designing and establishing a risk strategy, roadmap, challenge programs, engagement model and frameworks to proactively monitor and address adverse risks brought on by advanced D&A technologies.
  • Enterprise Risk Oversight: Provide informed risk oversight and challenge to ensure that risks associated with data architecture, analytics platforms, and 3rd party D&A vendors are identified and managed in alignment with the organization’s risk appetite. The individual should understand the Operational Risk Management framework to identify and interpret enterprise risk exposures, issues, losses, trends and early warning signs and developing and leading the 2nd Line challenge program. 
  • Subject matter support and advisory: Be a trusted risk advisor & subject matter expertise (in the delivery and management of advanced D&A technologies) to T&O and businesses across the bank. Provide objective and independent risk expert advice and counsel to businesses, working with corporate partners on preventative measures to address potential adverse effects from advanced D&A technology. Act as a trusted advisor to senior leaders making business & technology decisions and implementing strategic initiatives.
  • Emerging trend monitoring and industry liaison: Proactively monitor trends and developments in advanced D&A technologies, their applications in the financial service sector and relevant risk management practices. Identify emerging issues and interpret implications to BMO to inform decision making. Network with industry contacts to gather competitive insights and best practice. Act as the primary contact for internal/external stakeholder relationships, which may include regulatory bodies related to D&A risks.

Knowledge & Skills:

  • University degree in Data science, Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics, Engineering or other quantitative disciplines, or equivalent professional experience in technology development/management delivering data repositories, analytic systems or digital services.
  • Expert subject matter knowledge in delivering advanced data & analytic technology solutions, including, AI and other emerging technologies (Blockchain, Open Banking, Cloud computing, DLT, IoT, etc.). Technical knowledge of quantitative techniques, development lifecycles and tools utilized in analytics teams, with a good grasp of how to effectively manage these risks.
  • Deep knowledge data architecture and system design, including data design, storage, and data transfer of both structured and unstructured data.  Strong understanding of the software development processes including end-to-end system delivery processes, and design of operational resiliency. 
  • Experience and understanding of Fintech vendors is as asset. 
  • 5+ years in management consulting. Prior experience in a consulting/advisory firm is an asset
  • Experienced in framing and communicating complex problems and ideas into easy to understand concepts by preparing frameworks, building decks and providing supporting materials to internal and external stakeholders
  • Experienced in designing, leading, facilitating, and participating in cross-functional workshops focused on bringing diverse teams together to inform and align on a shared set of goals/strategies
  • Proven experience in identifying, assessing and monitoring non-financial risk, leveraging extensive insights and experience within the industry. Superior ability to effectively communicate risk and threat topics to executives and secure support. Current experience in managing emerging technology risk an asset.
  • Strong relationship building skills and expertise in collaborating with stakeholders across all levels of the organization. Provide visible leadership in the promotion of sound enterprise risk management practices across the organization, in the emerging technology space.
  • Excellent business acumen and analytical skills, including financial and business analysis, research, and complex methodological concepts with demonstrated aptitude for strategic and critical thinking. Ability to set a vision, manage roadblocks and execute through influence across all stages of a risk program lifecycle.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, maintain focus and prioritize in a dynamic, fast-paced and at times ambiguous and pressurized environment
  • Experience working with cloud service and other emerging technology providers (MS Azure, Google, LUIS, etc.) is an asset
  • Experience with AI programming language (R, Python, etc.) and data visualization tools (Spotfire, Power BI, PowerAPPS, etc.) is an asset

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

Applies knowledge of advanced analytic algorithms and technologies (e.g. machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence) to deliver better predictions and/or intelligent automation that enables smarter business decisions, improved customer experience, and drives productivity. Applies strong communication and story-telling skills to summarize statistical/algorithmic findings, draw business conclusions, and present actionable insight in a way that resonates with business/groups. Drives innovation through the development of Data & AI products that can be leveraged across the organization and establishes best practices in in alignment with Data & AI governance frameworks of BMO.

  • Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group.
  • Influences and negotiates to achieve business objectives.
  • Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.
  • Assists in the development of strategic plans.
  • Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
  • Understands and analyzes complex business problem, then formulates data-driven hypotheses to drive business value.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
  • Supports data collection, integration, and retention requirements for data.
  • Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
  • Defines innovative data solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets.
  • Diagnoses and resolves predictive / analytical model performance issues while monitoring system performance and implementation of efficiency improvements.
  • Applies innovative and best practices to advanced analytics services to ensure high quality standards.
  • Sets up change control and testing processes to ensure the quality and consistency of ongoing maintenance work.
  • Develops analytical solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
  • Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of analytical solutions.
  • Works with stakeholders to identify the business requirements, understand distinct problems and expected outcomes, and models and frames business scenarios which impact critical business processes and/or decisions.
  • Works with various data owners to discover and select available data from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system, and alternative data) to fulfill analytical needs.
  • Applies scripting / programming skills to assemble various types of source data (unstructured, semi-structured, and structured) into well-prepared datasets with multiple levels of granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
  • Develops agreed analytical solution by applying suitable statistical & machine learning techniques (e.g., A/B testing, prototype solutions, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence) to test, verify, refine hypotheses.
  • Summarizes statistical findings and draws conclusions, presents actionable business recommendations. Presents findings & recommendations in a simple, clear way to drive action.
  • Documents data flow, systems and processes in data collection to improve efficiency and apply use cases.
  • Performs experimental design approaches to validate finding or test hypotheses.
  • Uses the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
  • Supports development of tools and delivers training for data analytics and AI.
  • Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes.
  • Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
  • Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
  • Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
  • Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

    Qualifications:

  • Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Advanced degree (Ph.D. preferred) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or other quantitative disciplines and/or equivalent experience
  • Experience with distributed computing language (e.g. Hive / Hadoop/ Spark) & cloud technologies (e.g. AWS Sagemaker, AzureML).
  • Experience with programming languages (e.g. SQL, Python, R, SAS, SPSS, , Perl) and machine learning /deep learning algorithms/packages (e.g. XGBoost, H2O, SparkML).
  • Deep proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms.
  • Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
  • Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
  • Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
  • Influence skills - In-depth.
  • Data driven decision making - In-depth.

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

item.title: AI Developer
item.description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Technology

Responsibilities for this role will include:

  • Prototyping solutions to evaluate the impact of selected algorithms on the target problem.
  • Collaborating with technology and business teams to converge on the best solutions.
  • Optimizing algorithms and prototypical solutions for efficient implementation.
  • Extending prototypes into fully functional, polished solutions ready for internal and/or external use.
  • Supporting projects with thorough documentation of usage, design decisions and capabilities.
  • Extracting, transforming and loading massive datasets using distributed computing framework technologies (Hadoop, Spark, etc.).
  • Demoing products and projects to various internal and external stakeholders.

Requirements:

  • Education - Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent.
  • Proficiency with Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow, Theano, Keras and PyTorch.
  • Strong coder with a development background.
  • Experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in Python 3.x.
  • Interest or experience in one of the following areas: Traditional Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Speech recognition, Time-Series Analysis, Computer Vision, Reinforcement Learning.
  • Experience with data visualization using D3.js, Chart.js, plotly or other open-source library.
  • Familiarity with the Unix command line and bash scripting.
  • Exposure to distributed computing frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases 

Understands that the success of a developer is to understand the core business processes of the business unit and business requirements as well as the architecture patterns and technology strategy (e.g., Transformation, SmartCore, DevOps). Conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements. Writes, configures, and integrates code to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy. Understands the implications of various components (including technology strategy & architecture) to the overall design of a program, system, or eco-system. Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security). Works toward the objective of defect free software. Ensures that systems functionally meet requirements, align with architecture and promote the development of common assets. Supports the resolution of production issues and problems. Makes recommendations to improve BMO processes & systems.

  • Assesses impact of design decisions to the computer solution/product/service being developed (i.e. performance, schedule, budget, downstream component/system impact, quality, etc.) and recommends alternate/creative solutions for mitigation/optimization if required.
  • Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.
  • Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
  • Leads and implements initiatives as required to deliver business objectives.
  • Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
  • Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.
  • Leads/conducts detailed code-reviews and provides feedback in a constructive manner.
  • Decomposes business requirements and translates them into detailed design specifications and code.
  • Interacts with key business & technology stakeholders to define, analyze, and deliver requirements that reflect the needs of both the business and end-customers.
  • Assesses the costs and benefits for different solutions and recommend/decide on appropriate designs.
  • Designs solutions, writes code, performs unit testing, develops appropriate artefacts / documentation, and facilitates final delivery.
  • Supports production issues, includes independently completing root-cause analysis and diagnosis.
  • Devises new algorithms and data structures for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with architectural patterns.
  • Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets.
  • Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Supports the management of specific project deliverables & outcomes.
  • Identifies opportunities to strengthen the development capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks.
  • Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.
  • Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
  • Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
  • Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
  • Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

    Qualifications:

  • Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and/or certification in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Advanced level of knowledge in domain.
  • Knowledge of software development practices, concepts, and technology obtained through formal training and/or work experience.
  • Knowledge of required programming languages and can code with little oversight.
  • Knowledge of technical/business environment and processes.
  • Understand functional aspects and technical behavior of the underlying operating system, development environment, and deployment practices.
  • Have facility with and understanding of the ecosystem that code operates in.
  • Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
  • Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
  • Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
  • Influence skills - In-depth.
  • Data driven decision making - In-depth.

By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
